sense.name: the largest proportion of something
sense.commentary: MAJORITY[+quantity][+largest] Note: a general notion of largest proportion, need not be half, just more than any other allocation. Note: can be a proportion of a set of things (people), or a single thing (pie)
sense.examples: A majority of the students accepted to that college are from the midwest. I would say Pete ate the majority of the chocolate cake. Among our customers, the majority care more about economizing than attaining status symbols.

sense.name: the number of votes required to win an election
sense.commentary: MAJORITY[+quantity][+proportion][+vote][+51_percent/+predominant] Note: a narrow sense of sense 1, implies legal stipulations about the votes required in a context
sense.examples: The Democrats may regain the majority of Senate seats in the next election. The leading candidate didn't win a majority so there will be a runoff. He now owns the majority of the stock in that company. (implies voting clout) John believes the purpose of the state is to balance individual rights against majority rule.

sense.name: the age at which one is legally an adult
sense.examples: The defendant has reached majority and so will not be tried as a minor. Mandated child support usually ends when the children reach majority.

sense.name: the military rank of major
sense.examples: Bob achieved majority in the army before he retired. Those captains must obey him because he has majority. (US major outranks captain in the army)
